title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEMS STRENGTHENED

description.narrative: Output 2.1: Social protection systems strengthened to improve the focus on the most vulnerable., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid), Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 2: Evidence generated for policy advocacy for inclusion in social services by 2020.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF GENDER AND FAMILY AND S SERVICES
THE OXFORD POVERTY AND HUMAN DEVELO OPHI

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1: Social protection systems strengthened to improve the focus on the most vulnerable.

description.narrative: A major milestone has been reached in that the Government of Maldives, with UNICEF's support, finalized the first-ever Maldives Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) in 2019. The President's Office has already expressed intent to utilize the MPI in improving the future reform process of the national social protection system. Furthermore, UNICEF supported the National Social Protection Agency (NSPA) in evaluating two key Social Protection Schemes, namely the Foster Care and Single Parent schemes, resulting in key recommendations on how to increase effectiveness and efficiency for the most at-risk children in the Maldives. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/12/2019
